info.title: Triton CloudAPI
info.description: Triton CloudAPI - public-facing REST API for managing virtual machines, images, networks, volumes, and other resources

put.summary: Replace account role tags
put.description: This endpoint replaces all role tags on the account itself (the machines collection). Returns the resource name and the updated list of role tags.

get.summary: Stream VM state changes via WebSocket
get.description: Provides real-time notifications of VM state transitions for monitoring tools and dashboards. Requires WebSocket protocol upgrade.

put.summary: Update configuration

get.description: Returns a map of datacenter names to their URLs.

put.summary: Replace role tags on the datacenters collection
Update fabric VLAN
Update fabric network

get.description: Returns a map of foreign datacenter names to their URLs.

put.summary: Replace role tags on the firewall rules collection
Replace role tags on a specific firewall rule
Replace role tags on the images collection
Replace role tags on a specific image

post.description: This endpoint handles multiple actions via the action query parameter: - update: Update image metadata - export: Export image to Manta - clone: Clone image to account - import-from-datacenter: Import image from another datacenter

put.summary: Replace role tags on the keys collection
Replace role tags on a specific SSH key

parameters.name: docker
parameters.description: Filter by docker flag (added in CloudAPI 8.0.0)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by machine type (smartmachine or virtualmachine)

parameters.name: docker
parameters.description: Filter by docker flag (added in CloudAPI 8.0.0)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by machine type (smartmachine or virtualmachine)

put.summary: Replace machine role tags
put.description: Replaces all role tags on a specific machine resource.

post.description: This endpoint handles multiple actions via the action query parameter: - start: Start a stopped machine - stop: Stop a running machine - reboot: Reboot a running machine - resize: Resize to a different package - rename: Change machine name/alias - enable_firewall: Enable firewall - disable_firewall: Disable firewall - enable_deletion_protection: Enable deletion protection - disable_deletion_protection: Disable deletion protection

get.description: Returns an estimate of the migration size and duration for a machine.

post.description:
Performs a migration action on a machine. The `action` field in the request body specifies the operation:

- `begin`: Start a new migration. Optionally accepts `affinity` rules. - `sync`: Sync data to the target server. - `switch`: Switch the instance to the new server (finalize migration). - `automatic`: Perform automatic migration (begin + sync + switch). - `abort`: Cancel the migration and clean up. - `pause`: Pause an in-progress migration. - `finalize`: Clean up after a successful switch.

Returns the updated migration object (except for `finalize` which returns an empty response on success).

put.summary: Replace machine tags

get.summary: Connect to machine VNC console via WebSocket
get.description: Provides browser-based VNC console access to KVM/bhyve virtual machines. Only available for running machines. Requires WebSocket protocol upgrade. Available since API version 8.4.0.
Returns a list of all migrations for the account.
Returns details about a specific migration.
Streams real-time migration progress updates via WebSocket. Returns a stream of JSON objects with progress information.

Brand.description:
VM/Container brand

The brand determines the virtualization/containerization technology used. Valid brands as defined in `lib/machines.js`: - `bhyve`: FreeBSD hypervisor for hardware VMs - `joyent`: Native SmartOS zone - `joyent-minimal`: Minimal SmartOS zone - `kvm`: KVM hardware VM - `lx`: Linux-branded zone (Linux containers)

CreateAccessKeyResponse.description: Response when creating access key (includes secret)

secret.description: Access key secret (only provided on creation)

CreateImageRequest.description: Request to create image from machine

machine.description: Machine UUID to create image from

affinity.description:
Affinity rules for instance placement (added in CloudAPI v8.3.0)

Rules follow the pattern: `<key><operator><value>` where: - key: 'instance', 'container', or a tag name - operator: '==' (must), '!=' (must not), '==~' (prefer), '!=~' (prefer not) - value: exact string, glob pattern (*), or regex (/pattern/)

Examples: `instance==myvm`, `role!=database`, `instance!=~foo*`

allowSharedImages.description: Allow using images shared with this account (not owned by it)

brand.description: Brand (bhyve, kvm, joyent, joyent-minimal, lx) If not specified, inferred from the image

delegateDataset.description: Create a delegated ZFS dataset for the zone Only applicable to zone-based instances (joyent, joyent-minimal, lx brands)

encrypted.description: Request placement on encrypted compute nodes

networks.description: Networks (array of UUIDs) - simple network specification

nics.description: NICs - advanced NIC specification with IP addresses and options

volumes.description: Volumes to mount on the instance

DiskSpec.description: Disk specification for bhyve instance creation

image.description: Image UUID for this disk (for boot disk or additional image-backed disks)

acl.description: ACL - list of account UUIDs with access (API version >= 7.1.0)

error.description: Error information (if image creation failed, API version >= 7.1.0)

imageSize.description: Image size in bytes (zvol images only)

ImageError.description: Image error information (for failed image creation)

ImageRequirements.description:
Image requirements

Specifies hardware/software requirements for an image.

computeNode.description: Compute node UUID (server hosting the VM)

delegateDataset.description: Whether a delegate dataset is present

encrypted.description: Whether the VM uses encrypted storage

flexible.description: Whether the VM uses flexible disk mode (bhyve only)

freeSpace.description: Free space in bytes (bhyve with flexible disk)

MachineDisk.description: Disk attached to a machine (bhyve VMs)

MachineState.description:
Machine state

These states reflect the possible values returned by VMAPI's `translateState()`: - `provisioning`: VM is being created (includes configured, incomplete, unavailable) - `ready`: VM is ready but not started (occurs during reboot) - `running`: VM is running - `stopping`: VM is in the process of stopping (includes halting, shutting_down) - `stopped`: VM is stopped (includes off, down, installed) - `offline`: VM is offline (agent not responding, unreachable) - `deleted`: VM has been destroyed - `failed`: VM is in a failed state - `unknown`: VM state cannot be determined

MigrateRequest.description:
Migration request

Used to perform migration actions on an instance. The `action` field specifies which migration operation to perform.

# Examples

Start a new migration: ```json {"action": "begin"} ```

Start migration with affinity rules: ```json {"action": "begin", "affinity": ["instance!=web-*"]} ```

Switch to the new server: ```json {"action": "switch"} ```

Abort an in-progress migration: ```json {"action": "abort"} ```

affinity.description:
Affinity rules (only valid for "begin" and "automatic" actions)

These rules influence which server the instance will be migrated to.

automatic.description: Whether this is an automatic migration

vmUuid.description:
Machine UUID being migrated

Note: The Node.js CloudAPI translates VMAPI's `vm_uuid` to `machine`. We keep `vm_uuid` here for direct VMAPI compatibility, but the field may be renamed to `machine` in the response.

MigrationAction.description:
Migration action to perform

These actions control the migration lifecycle: - `begin`: Start a new migration - `sync`: Sync data to target server - `switch`: Switch instance to new server (finalize the migration) - `automatic`: Perform automatic migration (begin + sync + switch) - `abort`: Cancel the migration and clean up - `pause`: Pause an in-progress migration - `finalize`: Clean up after a successful switch

PackageDisk.description: Disk configuration in a package (bhyve only)

RoleTagsResponse.description: Response after replacing role tags on a resource

role-tag.description: List of role names assigned to the resource

VolumeMount.description: Volume mount specification for instance creation
